smartgov.urban.geo.environment.graph

Class DistanceCosts

  • java.lang.Object
    • smartgov.urban.geo.environment.graph.DistanceCosts
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.graphstream.algorithm.AStar.Costs

    public class DistanceCosts
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.graphstream.algorithm.AStar.Costs
    AStar costs that can be used with GeoNodes and GeoArcs, that uses geographic distance between nodes as the heuristic, and arc lengths as costs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DistanceCosts(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends Node> nodes, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends Arc> arcs)
      DistanceCosts constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      double cost(org.graphstream.graph.Node parent, org.graphstream.graph.Edge from, org.graphstream.graph.Node next)
      Returns generic arc length, that should correspond to the geographical GeoArc length in this context.
      double heuristic(org.graphstream.graph.Node node, org.graphstream.graph.Node target)
      Heuristic that returns the geographical distance between the specified nodes.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DistanceCosts

        public DistanceCosts(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends Node> nodes,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends Arc> arcs)
        DistanceCosts constructor. Responsibility is left to the user to make sure that specified arcs and nodes (that usually come from the current SmartGovContext or Graph instance) are GeoArcs and GeoNodes, in order to avoid cumbersome map casting. If its not the case, a ClassCastException will be raised when trying to compute a cost.
        Parameters:
        nodes - current graph geo nodes
        arcs - current graph geo arcs
